title.native: キングダム 第2シリーズ

description:
The second season of Kingdom.

A year after the devastating battle against the formidable Zhao, the State of Qin has returned its focus to pursuing King Ying Zheng's ambition of conquering the other six states and unifying China. Their next target is Wei, a smaller state which stands as a geographic stepping stone for the sake of conquest.

Xin, now a three hundred man commander of the swiftly rising Fei Xin Unit, continues to seek out lofty achievements in order to garner recognition for himself and his soldiers, motivated by those previously lost in battle. In the preliminary battles ahead of Qin's invasion of Wei, Xin finds competition in other young commanders who are of a higher social status than him. Back in Qin, the royal palace faces turmoil as opposing factions begin to make their move against Ying Zheng's regime.

With their hands full both abroad and at home, Zheng and Xin must lead the way in this era of unending war, resolved to etch their names in history by creating a unified China.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: Ancient China
tags.description: Setting in ancient china, does not apply to fantasy settings.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

title.native: キングダム
キングダム
キングダム 第3シリーズ

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/harayassa)

Yasuhisa Hara is a Japanese mangaka well known for his manga series Kingdom. His manga won the grand prize in the 17th Tezuka Osamu Cultural Bunkashō in 2013. 

In 2012, Kingdom was penned in the Guinness Book of World Records for being the manga drawn by the most people in recorded history (1087 in total). This was during the 'Social Kingdom' campaign celebrating the airing of the Kingdom anime in the same year. The likes of [Eiichirou Oda](https://anilist.co/staff/96881/Eiichirou-Oda), [Hirohiko Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/97619/Hirohiko-Araki), [Takehiko Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/96911/Takehiko-Inoue), and [Masashi Kishimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96879/Masashi-Kishimoto) were amongst the participants during the event. 

Kingdom has a grand live-action movie that released on April 19, 2019 with a nifty budget of 2 billion yen (~$18 million) according to comicbook.com. The movie covers the first five volumes of the original manga and is loyal to the scripts verified by Yasuhisa Hara, with TOHO aiming for it to gross 4 billion yen. The likes of Yamazaki Kento, Yoshizawa Ryo, Hashimoto Kanna, and Nagasawa Masami are amongst the lead cast of the movie, with Shinsuke Sato as the director.

Amongst the most selling manga in the past decade, Hara Yasuhisa's Kingdom remains the only one without any license from an English outlet. VIZ, who are largely loyal to Shueisha, have been reluctant to pick it up despite it being one of the most popular series in Japan.

The Sketchbook were real-life rock band which was created through The Sketchbook Project is named from the band formed by Sket Dan during the Kaimei Rock Festival. The band has been active since the formal announcement of their formation in July 2011, and have performed the vast majority of opening/ending themes for the Sket Dance anime. Disbanded after a final performance March 23, 2015.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sketchbook)

Members:
• [Hiroshi Tada](https://anilist.co/staff/108743) (多田 宏, Tada Hiroshi) Vocals/Bass
• [Riko Kohara](https://anilist.co/staff/120173) (小原 莉子, Kohara Riko) Guitar
• [Yuu Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/322987) (渡邊 悠, Watanabe Yuu) Drums

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/荒川稔久)

Married to fellow scriptwriter [Hiroko Naka](https://anilist.co/staff/181820/).
_Note: Not to be confused with the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/115140/)._
D-Date was established in December 2012 by Watanabe Entertainment. In 2004 the talent agency formed their special all-boys young actor unit D-Boys, of which 5 were chosen to form the band.
